triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs are the core technology analyzed in this survey for enhancing human-robot interaction capabilities.

triples.name: Robotics
triples.relevance: Robotic systems are the primary application domain for the integration of LLMs discussed in the survey.

triples.name: Human-robot interaction
triples.relevance: The primary task and field of study that the survey focuses on, examining how LLMs enhance HRI.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: Core method enabling LLMs to understand and process human language in robotic systems.

triples.name: Multimodal learning
triples.relevance: Key capability for LLMs to handle multimodal inputs such as text, images, and sensor data in robotics.

triples.name: Reasoning system
triples.relevance: Essential for LLMs to perform high-level reasoning and generate appropriate robot behavior plans.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: Critical method for plan generation that enables robots to decompose and execute complex tasks.

triples.name: Graphical model
triples.relevance: Probabilistic models used in traditional approaches for decision-making and reasoning in robotic systems.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: Framework for value functions and optimal decision-making in robotic control and learning.

triples.name: Information privacy
triples.relevance: Critical challenge addressed in the survey regarding data protection in human-robot systems.

triples.name: Machine ethics
triples.relevance: Essential ethical considerations for ensuring responsible behavior of AI-enabled robots in human environments.
